title: Wayne Larrivee speaking at St. John the Baptist
text:
Wayne Larrivee speaking at St. John the Baptist Sheboygan Press Media 3:09 p.m. CDT October 1, 2015 Wayne Larrivee, the radio voice of Green Bay Packers, will speak on “The Power of Faith in Pro-Sports” at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Plymouth at 7 p.m., Tuesday, Oct. 13. (Photo: Gannett Wisconsin Media) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Wayne Larrivee, the radio voice of Green Bay Packers, will speak on “The Power of Faith in Pro-Sports” at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Plymouth at 7 p.m., Tuesday, Oct. 13. 
The event is sponsored by St. John the Baptist and St. Thomas Aquinas parishes and is free and open to the public. Seating is limited. Those wishing to attend need to reserve a seat by calling the parish office at 920-892-4006 or by clicking on an event registration link at sjbplymouth.org. 
Larrivee is in his 38th consecutive year broadcasting NFL games. He has been broadcasting games in Green Bay for 17 years having joined Green Bay’s broadcast team following 14 seasons as the radio voice of the Chicago Bears (1985-1998) on WGN and WMAQ Radio in Chicago. Earlier, he had done play-by-play of Kansas City Chiefs games for seven years (1978-1984) on KCMO Radio in Kansas City, play-by-play for Big Ten Conference football and basketball for ESPN and the Big Ten Network as well as NCAA basketball for Dial Global. 
The 60-year-old Larrivee was named Illinois Sportscaster of the Year in 1997 and is a seven-time winner of the Silver Dome Award, presented by the Illinois Broadcasters Association, for best radio football play-by-play. He is also a four-time winner of a Midwest Emmy for Chicago Bulls basketball play-by-play. In May 2011, he was honored as Communicator of the Year by the Wisconsin Chapter of the Public Relations Society of America. Read or Share this story: http://shebpr.es/1FJ6lrZ TOP VIDEOS
